channel.title: Pi
channel.description: How do i make a login message? Like Owner Mike has logged in? I am using PI

item.title: Pi
item.dc:creator: @David-mod_of_lordsca David-mod_of_lordscape
item.description:
@David-mod_of_lordsca wrote:

loginMessage(); public void loginMessage() { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; switch (playerRights){ case 0: //Regular Player c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 1: //Donator c2.sendMessage("[DONATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 2: c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Moderator] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 3: c2.sendMessage("[GLOBAL MODERATOR] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 4: c2.sendMessage("@yel@[Adminstrator "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; case 5: c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner] "+playerName+" has logged in."); break; } } } }

Anywhere in your Client.Java

then go to Initialize or w/e and do

item.title: Pi
item.dc:creator: @TormentedSoul TormentedSoul
item.description:
@TormentedSoul wrote:

Add this into your client.java
But instead of putting @blu@ for the colour blue use <col=255><shad=0> which is a hexadecimal color and works for most project insanity bases.

Here is a site where you can play around mixing colors and find the colour code you want.
http://www.mathsisfun.com/hexadecimal-decimal-colors.html

public void loginMessage() {
for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
switch (playerRights){
case 0: //Regular Player
c2.sendMessage("[PLAYER] “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
case 1: //Donator
c2.sendMessage("[DONATOR] “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
case 2:
c2.sendMessage("@gre@[Moderator] “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
case 3:
c2.sendMessage("[GLOBAL MODERATOR] “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
case 4:
c2.sendMessage("@yel@[Adminstrator “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
case 5:
c2.sendMessage("@red@[Owner] “+playerName+” has logged in.");
break;
}
}
}
}

Read full topic
